item.title: How to remove silence at start and end of songs in your music collection
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: After failing to remove the songs's silences only from the start or the end with FFmpeg, I ended up using an open-source tool (mp3splt-gtk) to achieve this. It did not have a particular good default settings for this purpose but it ended up doing a perfect job.

item.title: Making my first game (another Pong) in Python.
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: Thanks to the power of Python and the open-source library Pyxel I have managed to make my very first game, a Pong game. Pyxel is a library that helps to make retro-like games. The path was no bed of roses but the game is 100% playable, and you can play in your browser.

item.title: Repurposing an old Pinnacle TV capture card
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: As an analogue video-capturing device. In this post, I explain how to make an old tv Pinnacle capture card (chipset Bt848) work in a modern Windows 10 x64 pro. Using a modded version of DScaler, we can use either the composite or S-video entrance to capture analogue video signals such as the PSone.

item.title: Use of Jupyter notebooks on ArcGIS pro to display flood results
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: Yet another post about how to optimise the workflow of plotting hydraulic results using GIS software. This time I will use the Jupyter notebook function inside of ArcGIS.

item.title: A script to automatize the plot of several rasters in the same Q-GIS layout
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: I present MultiLayout. A still (little bit) clunky Q-GIS workspace and a python script that would help you at plotting the results of hydraulic simulations.

item.title: An analysis of the effects of panel markers on a cross-section's conveyance curve
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: In this article, I present the effects of panelling a 1D cross-section. Panelling is the terminology used by the software Flood Modellerâ„¢ to divide the cross-section's hydraulic properties (mostly the hydraulic radius) into a sum of them. The article contains a theory introduction about Manning's n formula and 5 cross-sections are analysed with different panelling scenarios.

item.title: Linear and bilinear interpolation in Excel
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: An excel template to search in a table of values for certain item, and if it doesn't exist, then performs a linear intepolation between the 2 closest values.

item.title: Tic Tac Toe in Fortran90
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: In this post, I analyse the first comprehensive program I have ever created: A Tic-Tac-Toe game designed in Fortran90 to play against the computer! And the challenges that I had to face to make it work.

item.title: How to classify your music collection by genre. The Ricardo approach.
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: I have tried to classify my music library by Genre. After several trials and errors with different software, I surrendered and went manual. You will read the problem I encountered, my initial approach and how I used R and last.fm API to help me circumscribing the multiple options.

item.title: Games in Excel/VBA 2048 and minesweeper
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: I made the game 2048 and Mine-Sweeper in Excel/VBA to self-teach Excel coding. The code is not optimal but they do work!

item.title: UK map
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: Just a drawing of the Great Britain island in the style of Tolkyen.

item.title: Notepad++ theme (Solarized Dark) version for tuflow, FM and markdown files.
item.dc:creator: Ricardo M. Rubert
item.description: User-defined files for Notepad++ that colourise Tuflow configuration files (tcf, tgc, tbc, tmf, ecf, tlf...), Flood Modeller simulation files (ief) and markdown (md) files with the Solarized Dark colour scheme.
